body.p:
Grant County Ky
Nov: 19th 1863.
To His Excellency
The Governor of Kentucky

Your Petitioner D. E. Craig respectfully states that at the late October term of the Grant Circuit Court he was fined Thirtywenty Dollars under an indictment for gaming on the premises of James W. Collins in WmsTown. He says that he was indicted and fined heretofore for the same act. The testimony before the trial jury at the late term was that of only one witness ^B. Wilson^ who testified with much Doubt as to whether the supposed gaming was within five years before the finding of the indictment. Since the finding of the indict at the late term, he has convened with the witness and he now says that the gaming he referred to is the same for which your petitioner was personally fined and that He is now satisfied that it accured more than five years ago ^before the finding of said indictments^. Your Petitioner would further state that he has not played at any games on the premises of said Collins or elsewhere in WmsTown within five years before the finding of said indictment

Grant Cir Ct
vs
D. E. Craig
Gaming
$20 --
23d Nov 1863

Remit all except costs & fees
Tho E Bramlette
Govr
